author: m galligan
comment: I continue to be astounded by the atrocious grammar and lack of proofreading. I love reading the news and the CNN content is great but NPR and the BBC manage to produce the same product without all the annoying autocorrect and grammatical errors.

author: Eric Shelton
comment: Looking for a reliable news source. But every time I check cnn all I get is fake/ biased stories. Not news

author: Douglas Ouderkirk
comment: I enjoyed getting notifications of breaking news events, but the articles in this app are clearly opinions.  If you are looking for news that is not biased and opinionated, you may want to try something like the NPR app.

author: chad schoening
comment: Way way too many ads. Every video has a 15 sec commercial.

author: Angelina spirit wolf angel rosselle
comment: What the heck is this app why is it on my phone I am  a kid this is terrible appp

author: May Briscoe
comment: Wish I had cable tv (too expensive) so I could watch!!

author: Nickolas Alexander
comment: I like it. I just wish my alerts never stopped

author: albert vrieling
comment: Objective newsreports from all over the world.
Love the real news. Can do without the silly news like Kardashian and such.

author: Juan Alfaro
comment: Don't bother downloading this app. The CNN coverage and articles in the app are nothing like the coverage you will see on TV. This is a long review but I will try to explain clearly why I think this. Mostly it's just a bunch of articles offering opinions and biased reports under the guise of "analysis." It's a bit infuriating to see such blatant disregard for objective reporting of fact.  I guarantee you can't open a single article without having some random know it all journalist inserting their own views or opinions into the mix and framing it as a correct attitude. As an example, when you open up the app you see "Top News" as the first category alongside "Politics," "Money," etc. However, most recently under Top News I saw:  "GOP Senator Ben Sasse's Sassy week Criticising Donald Trump" "Donald Trump's Just Say Stuff Strategy" and  "Trumps White House Chaos is Rocking the World"  Why is it that these supposed Top News Headlines sound more like some teenage blog post than a professional accounting of world events? You open up the articles and, after reading closely, can see that these articles try to subtly influence opinions of current events by reporting facts in a frame of narrative designed to lead people to believe in their opinions.   To which some might say, "Yeah, no duh, it's an Opinion." But ask yourself this, "Why in the WORLD should we care about their opinions??" Who are they?? What qualifies them to force their opinion on me? Their opinions DO NOT belong on a Top News category for one of the largest news sources the common American accesses on a daily basis! I'm interested in the facts, NOT YOUR OPINION! Quit treating world news like your personal blog!  While the examples I gave specifically pertain to Trump, these "Analysis" articles are written about everything under the sun. If you want actual objective reporting don't waste your time on this app, it's better to watch the actual news segments on TV.

author: Cory Barrett
comment: Very biased to the left

comment: Needs a new ( update)it

author: Krista Errickson
comment: One of the only network apps to finally be able to move to ext. SD card!😘👍😀 thanks, developers! Runs flawlessly, no hiccups.  If only the app developers could run CNN - news might be news again..instead of the sports event CNN head & Apprentice creator Jeff Zucker has made it to be.  Poor Ted Turner.😫 What a nightmare his vision turned out to be in the hands of a monster😡.

author: Tyler Spencer
comment: Would be good but the app performs terribly.  Constantly freezing, stuttering, etc.  There is a weird scrolling issue.  It also says weak connection almost every time I open the app.  When I click retry it works right away.  Seems like it might be a way to get extra clicks.  I like CNN but the app needs serious work.

author: Stephen St Onge
comment: Skeptical at first as most news apps suck... But the ability to reliably stream CNN in Canada from any device (access included in cable package) has almost every other TV app for Canada beat! Live news from anywhere... Thanks!

author: Phil Rodriguez
comment: Terrible App. Now because of content. That is fine. The app itself is glitchy, slow, and goes unresponsive. I have it on 3 separate devices all are Android and not preform quick. Especially when clicking notifications. It often doesn't load the story or loads a different story then the notification. I would consider changing my response but for now it's 1 star.

author: Jan C
comment: I am really frustrated that the app won't open as expected. I get a "weak connection" message and/or it freezes when trying to open it. Why is this happening?  Its gone on for too long and others are reporting this same issue. Also, all my other apps open with no problem.  The Wi-Fi connection seems fine and I can open other apps when Wi-Fi is not on. Please fix. This is an app issue.

author: Kevin Youmans
comment: FAKE NEWS.  Pro-left propaganda very blatant. The problem is that sheep-le go here to get real news and are getting fleeced by a news organization with an agenda. Real news media should be trustworthy.

author: Debbie Rosner-Mulder
comment: Thank God for CNN. Tells the TRUTH, unlike the Trump News Channel (aka Fox news, aka fake news). The CNN app's "breaking  news" alert pop-ups on my android keep me updated on the most important news of the day. Great work CNN. You do the USA a great service.

author: Jessy Estep
comment: Easy to use. Always able to find breaking news. If u don't have the time to watch an entire news show (& commercials) or ( in my case) the patience, then this app is perfect for catching up on what's important to u in a lot less time...

author: David Chan
comment: CNN, Still one of the best news channel, for information on US and world current affairs. Generally articles are un-bias and have bothside of a story.  Unlike other US news network who I no longer follow.
